skills.description: Ability to package, deploy, and manage applications using containers, enabling consistent and reliable execution across diverse environment
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Docker, Singularity, Kubernetes
skills.training_resources: Reproducible computational environment with Docker

skills.title: Task automation/tool pipelines
skills.description: Expertise in creation and maintenance of automated workflows that build, test, and deploy software

skills.description: Ability to effectively elicit, analyse, and document the needs and requirements of stakeholders, translating them into a clear and actionable set of specifications

skills.title: Software patterns
skills.description: Ability to identify, understand, and apply well-established, reusable solutions to common problems in software development

skills.title: Designing APIs

skills.title: Programming for HPC and GPUs - theoretical concepts & principles

skills.title: Supercomputer architecture
skills.description: Understanding of supercomputer architectures (e.g., node types, interconnects, storage systems).

skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: SLURM (Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management), PBS (Portable Batch System), LSF (Load Sharing Facility), HTCondor, SGE (Sun Grid Engine). Cgroups

skills.title: Adaptability
skills.description: Ability to adjust to new conditions, changes in the environment, or unexpected challenges with flexibility and openness

skills.title: Business acumen
skills.description: Understanding and application of fundamental business principles to make informed decisions that drive success

skills.title: Being ethical and having integrity
skills.description: Acting with honesty, fairness, and respect, and upholding strong moral principles even when it's difficult or inconvenient

skills.description: Ability to identify, plan, and work toward achievable objectives, both short- and long-term, with focus and discipline

skills.title: Influencing, persuasion and negotiation

skills.title: Asking for help / asking to understand / asking questions

skills.title: Using collaborative apps/tools for remote work/collaboration

skills.title: Team management
skills.description: Ability to lead, coordinate, and motivate a group of individuals to achieve common goals

skills.title: Team performance management
skills.description: Ability to set goals, monitor progress, provide feedback, and evaluating the performance of team members to improve efficiency and effectiveness

skills.title: Hiring people / writing job descriptions
skills.description: Ability to recruite suitable candidates for a position, including the creation of clear and effective job descriptions that outline roles, responsibilities, qualifications, and expectations.

skills.title: Team building
skills.description: Ability to bring new people, foster a positive and collaborative environment that strengthens relationships, improves communication, and enhances teamwork within a group.

skills.title: Team development
skills.description: Ability to improve skills, knowledge, and overall capabilities in a team through training, mentoring, and other developmental activities

skills.title: Recognising/giving credit for people's work
skills.description: Acknowledging and appreciating the contributions and achievements of team members, reinforcing positive behavior and boosting morale

skills.title: Shielding colleagues from destructive criticism
skills.description: Protecting team members from unconstructive or harmful feedback by offering support and ensuring criticism is delivered in a constructive, respectful manner

skills.title: Understanding others’ goals and motivations
skills.description: Ability to empathise with and gain insight into the personal and professional goals of others, allowing for better collaboration, conflict resolution, and alignment within teams

skills.title: Mentoring & coaching
skills.description: Providing guidance, support, and advice to a less experienced individual to help them grow personally and professionally
skills.training_resources: Mentor training

skills.title: Decision-making
skills.description: Ability to assess information, weigh options, consider potential outcomes, and choose the best course of action in a given situation

skills.title: Motivation and inspiration
skills.description: Ability to encourage, energise, and empower others to take action, pursue goals, or strive for continuous improvement

skills.title: Grant proposal/business case writing
skills.description: Understanding the needs and interests of potential funders or decision-makers, articulating the goals and benefits of the proposed project or business case in a clear and persuasive way, and providing strong justification for why it should be supported.
skills.training_resources: Everything you wanted to know about applying for grants but didn't ask

skills.title: Long-term strategic planning
skills.description: Ability to envision, develop, and implement a roadmap for an organisation or initiative's future direction, goals, and objectives over an extended period (typically 3-5 years or more)

skills.title: Leading change
skills.description: Ability to create a shift in mindset and behavior, empowering individuals, and ensuring that the change is sustainable in the long run - drawing on emotional intelligence, strategic thinking, communication, and organisational management.

skills.title: Project governance
skills.description: Ability to establish and manage the frameworks, structures, and processes that guide and control projects throughout their lifecycle
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Decision making processes & tools, project governance dashboards

skills.title: Planning and organisation skills/task management & prioritisation
skills.description: Ability to effectively organise, assign, and track the use of resources (such as time, money, and human resources) in a project or organisation to ensure goals are achieved efficiently, within scope, and on schedule
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Resource allocation & management (time, money/budget/finances, human resources), delegation, monitoring progressSoftware Management Plans, GitHub projects, Asana, Trello, spreadsheets, Gantt charts, other project management tools

skills.title: Project scoping/setting realistic goals
skills.description: Ability to define and clarify the boundaries, objectives, and expected outcomes of a project, ensuring that they are achievable, measurable, and aligned with the available resources

skills.title: Project portfolio management
skills.description: Ability to oversee and manage a collection of projects within an organisation to ensure that they align with the strategic goals, priorities, and resource availability

skills.title: Project management methodologies
skills.description: Knowledge of the frameworks, processes, and best practices that guide how a project is planned, executed, monitored, and completed
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, PRINCE 2
skills.training_resources: University of Manchester internal Agile/Scrum course (work in progress); CSCCE's project management for STEM professionalsThe Harvard Business Review Project Management Handbook by Antonio Nieto-Rodriguez

skills.title: Risk management
skills.description: Ability to identify, assess, mitigate, and monitor risks that could negatively affect a project, organisation, or process
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Risk matrix tools

skills.title: Crisis & change management
skills.description: Ability to effectively navigate and manage sudden, unexpected situations (crisis) and significant transformations (change) within an organisation or project

skills.title: Event management
skills.description: Ability to plan, organise, and execute events efficiently, ensuring that all aspects are well-coordinated and meet the goals of the event
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Defining the event’s purpose and goals, creating a timeline, selecting a venue, negotiating prices, budgeting, identifying target audience, sponsorship and fundraising, eco-friendly practices, reducing carbon footprint, registrations, programme scheduling, website, promotion on social media, attendee feedback, event debrief and reporting

skills.title: Stakeholder management
skills.description: Ability to manage expectations of different stakeholders (e.g. partners and PIs), negotiation between partner needs and RSE practicalities

skills.title: Content and knowledge management
skills.description: Ability to organise, store, share, and leverage information and resources within an organisation or community effectively - easily accessible, well-documented, and utilised in decision-making, problem-solving, and innovation
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: SharePoint, Google Workspace (Google Drive, Docs, Sheets, etc.), Dropbox, Confluence, WordPress, Trello

skills.title: Meeting chairing and management
skills.description: Ability to effectively lead and facilitate meetings, ensuring they are productive, well-organised, all objectives are achieved and that participants engage in a respectful manner
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Setting agenda, guiding discussions, maintaining focus

skills.title: Process documentation & improvement
skills.description: Ability to analyse processes, workflows, procedures, identifying areas for improvement and synthesise best practices
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Best practices

skills.title: Understanding bureaucracy/politics
skills.description: Ability to navigate and make sense of the complex structures, rules, power dynamics, and interpersonal relationships within academic institutions

skills.title: Gathering and understanding (user, funder, stakeholder) requirements
skills.description: Ability to actively listen to and engage with users, funders, or stakeholders to identify their needs, expectations, and constraints - including asking the right questions, clarifying assumptions, and documenting requirements in a way that can guide project planning and delivery

skills.title: Converting requirements to tasks
skills.description: Ability to translate broad or high-level requirements into specific, actionable tasks that can be assigned, tracked, and completed, identifying dependencies, prioritising work, and ensuring each task contributes to the overall goal

skills.title: Breaking down problems into smaller tasks
skills.description: Ability to decompose complex challenges into manageable parts to make planning, development, or troubleshooting more efficient and less overwhelming
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Task management, opening good issues on a GitHub repository/creating tasks in Asana or similar platforms, etc.

skills.title: Customer engagement
skills.description: Building and maintaining positive relationships with customers or users by communicating clearly, understanding their needs, involving them in the process, gathering feedback and providing value and ensuring satisfaction with the final product or service

skills.title: Searching for the best solution for the job
skills.description: Ability to evaluating available options (tools, methods, technologies) and selecting the most effective, efficient, and context-appropriate solution - using critical thinking, awareness of constraints, and a good understanding of both the problem and possible solutions.

skills.title: Domain-specific background knowledge
skills.description: An understanding of concepts, theories, and best practices within a particular field or discipline

skills.title: Translating between software engineering language and stakeholders
skills.description: Bridging the gap between technical software engineering concepts and the language of non-software-engineer stakeholders, such as researchers, technicians, scientists, or other business or academic teams
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Understanding of both software engineering concepts and domain problems and terminologyUnderstanding stakeholder needs and contextsSimplifying technical jargonClarifying requirements

skills.title: Application/adaptability of technical skills in the domain
skills.description: Ability to effectively apply technical knowledge and skills within a specific domain while being flexible and adaptable to evolving needs, challenges, and technologies

skills.title: Specialist technical or hardware knowledge
skills.description: Knowledge of specialised computer or hardware systems designed to control specific functions within a larger device or machine
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Embedded systems, medical devices, radars, satellites, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, sensors, controlling actuators, System-on-Chip (SoC), Internet of Things (IoT)

skills.title: Research methodologies
skills.description: Expertise in research methodology - formulating testable predictions based on observations, theories, or existing knowledge and systematically evaluating them through empirical methods
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Qualitative and quantitative approaches, data collection techniques (listed under "Data collection & acquisition"), experimental design, statistical analysis, and critical evaluation of resources Experiments & Simulations – MATLAB, LabVIEWData Analysis Tools - listed under "Data analysis and visualisation"Reference Management & Literature Review Tools - Zotero, EndNote, MendeleySystematic Literature Review – Rayyan, Covidence, Paper Digest, Connected PapersResearch Project Management & Collaboration Tools - Trello, Asana, GitHubWriting & Formatting – LaTeX, Overleaf

skills.title: Reading & understanding research papers
skills.description: Ability to do literature review - find, read and digest relevant research and synthesise information from various sources (such as academic literature, reports, books, and research papers) and critically assess its relevance, credibility, and quality
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Finding papers on Google Scholar, ArXiV etc.
skills.training_resources: Often offered by university libraries

skills.title: Writing research papers
skills.description: Ability to present research ideas and work in research & scientific publications, including presenting evidence, evaluation, argumentation in academic paper structure
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: LaTeX, Overleaf, bibliography management tools (Zotero, BibTeX, Mendeley, EndNote)
skills.training_resources: academic writing workshops/courses

skills.title: Peer review of research papers
skills.description: Ability to povide constructive, evidence-based feedback on others’ work to improve quality, foster learning, and uphold standards
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Reviewing research & domain-specific papers and articles

skills.title: Ethical responsibility
skills.description: Ability to identify potential ethical concerns related to research subjects' welfare, data collection, storage and security methods, informed consent, privacy
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: GDPR, ethics approvals
skills.training_resources: https://www.dcc.ac.uk/sites/default/files/documents/publications/3amendedFive%20things.....%20(8-Page).pdf

skills.title: Legal and regulatory responsibility
skills.description: Understanding of legislation and legal responsibilities when conducting work in specific research areas
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Export control, intellectual property (IP), licensing, GDPR, clinical trials regulations, medical devices
skills.training_resources: https://www.uwe.ac.uk/study/library/research-support/manage-your-research-data/planning-your-project/know-your-legal-and-ethical-responsibilitieshttps://www.liverpool.ac.uk/library/research-data-management/essentials/ethical-and-legal/https://researchdata.ox.ac.uk/ethical-and-legal-issues

skills.title: Public speaking and presentation
skills.description: Public speaking, presentation and communication skills for engaging with a diverse audience
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Communication with technical audiences/peersCommunication with non-technical or cross-disciplinary audiences/other scientistsCommunication with general publicUnderstanding your audienceSpeaking clearly and confidently
skills.training_resources: Presenting Posters and Conference Talks - The Turing Way

skills.title: Information synthesis/concise communication
skills.description: Ability to summarise and condense information efficiently

skills.title: Technical writing
skills.description: Ability to create clear, concise, and structured technical documentation
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Producing papers, reports, technical documentation (e.g. user and developer guides for software), LaTeX, Overleaf, ReadtheDocs, MKDocs, Sphynx, (R)Markdown, Quarto

skills.title: Multimedia & social content production
skills.description: Ability to create, edit, and manage various forms of digital content across multiple media platforms, e.g. graphic design, audio/video/animation production, social media, etc.
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, Adobe Premiere Pro, OBS, YouTube, Mastodon, X, LinkedIn, BlueSky, Podcasts (?)
skills.training_resources: Social Media for Research Communications — The Turing Way

skills.title: Note taking
skills.description: Ability to document and organise meeting information
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Recording clear actions

skills.title: Active listening
skills.description: Ability to be an attentive and engaged listener

skills.title: Providing positive and constructive feedback
skills.description: Ability to offer supportive and insightful feedback and review comments on other's work to improve quality, foster learning, and uphold standards
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Reviewing conference submissions, articles, grant proposals, etc.
skills.training_resources: CSCCE mini-workshop on the topic of Giving and receiving feedback; Stone and Heen’s book Thanks for the Feedback

skills.title: Assertive declination
skills.description: Ability to set boundaries and decline requests assertively and politely

skills.title: Peer support
skills.description: Providing emotional, social and practical support to other members of a community from fostering mutual understanding, encouragement, and personal growth
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Encouraging people’s ideas

skills.title: Networking & relationship building
skills.description: Establishing connections to exhange knowledge, support and opportunities for growth
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Attending and/or running in-person or remote events to engage with the community |

skills.title: Raising awareness of issues
skills.description: Advocating for issues, e.g. raising awareness of RSE roles
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Careers events e.g. colleges, early-stage undergraduates / year in industry roles

skills.title: Community building & leadership
skills.description: Ability to inspire, guide and mobilise people toward a shared vision or a goal
skills.training_resources: Resources from CSCCE, for example the Community Participation Model: https://www.cscce.org/resources/cpm/; A guide to using virtual events to facilitate community building: Selecting and testing online tools; CSCCE's guide on how to steward large-scale collaborations

skills.title: Community governance & management
skills.description: Establishing structures, policies, and processes to guide decision-making, coordination, and engagement within a community
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Different community governance structures, organising and setting agenda for meetings, chairing meetings, advertising support and training, tools for engaging and communiting in a community (Slack, Mattermost)
skills.training_resources: Governance in The Turing WayMetaDocencia builds its governance collaboratively(spanish)

skills.title: Self-learning
skills.description: Ability to learn independently and teach yourself new technical and non-technical skills and tools
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Learning a new programming language or a tool

skills.title: Knowledge exchange
skills.description: Ability to share information, expertise and best practices within a team, organisation or community
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Writing onboarding documentation, onboarding new team members, internal presentations, pair programming

skills.title: Teaching & training others
skills.description: Ability to convey theoretical and practical knowledge to others, address misconceptions, etc. in training events
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Teaching or delivery of short training courses such as Carpentries or CodeRefinery lessons
skills.training_resources: Carpentries Instructor Training   Teaching tech togetherEnseñando tecnología en comunidad(Spanish)

skills.title: Training material development
skills.description: Solo and collaborative development of various short-format training materials (tutorials, courses, etc.)
skills.tools_languages_methods_behaviours: Collaborative development of open source training materials
skills.training_resources: Carpentries Collaborative Lesson Development Training
